intro: Tropalanthe, commonly known as the African violet, is a genus of flowering plants native to tropical Africa. These plants are characterized by their upright growth habit and showy, often colorful flowers that bloom throughout the year. The leaves are typically velvety and dark green, providing a striking contrast to the vibrant blooms. Tropalanthe species are popular as ornamental plants due to their beauty and ease of cultivation. They thrive in well-drained soil and require bright, indirect light to flourish.
